name: Impoundments and regulated reaches
functionStatement: Runoff and infiltration sustain natural flow regime, carry appropriate sediment and nutrients from uplands, and reliably cue spawning/migration of aquatic life.
descriptionMarkdown: Flow is near-natural, with no major dams or only negligible small ones, unless larger dams are historically normal.
howToMeasureMarkdown: Inventory dams and flow-regulated reaches that influence the reach and flag major impoundments or hydropeaking where present.

levels.label: Optimal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: No major dams, or only small and distant impoundments with negligible impact.

levels.label: Marginal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Multiple moderate dams reducing flood peaks or baseflow.

levels.label: Poor
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Heavily regulated system or hydropeaking from major impoundments.
